 This isn't a matter of faith. The difference between magic and miracles is this. Miracles are dependent on God alone. Man does not have control over them. That requires faith. Faith is only as good as the object of that faith. If I have faith that my gas tank is full and even get a thousand people to believe with me, my tank will not fill up unless I do something about it. 
 
 Magic depends on man. claiming that man can manipulate things unseen. Therefore, this can be tested scientifically. if man claims to have control, then he only need exercise that control so that it can be observed under scientific conditions. 
 
 God is not a Djin that can be called upon and controlled. That is why he cannot be tested scientifically. Magic can.

 You are correct that many christians view God this way. It is one of the reasons many christians live a defeated life. They expect God to deliver the goods and when He does not, then they wonder why? What is wrong with me?
 
 The answer is that the only thing wrong with them is their view of God. I do not believe God can be proven to anyone. Even the israelites who lived in the desert for forty years and SAW God lead them as a pillar of fire, watched the parting of the red sea, saw water come from dry rock, received manna from heaven to feed them, saw the glory of God fill the tabernacle and push Moses out, even they continued to disbelieve. It is in the nature of humans to discount miracles.
 
 However, we want to believe. It is evidenced by our fascination with religion and magic. We want the miraculous and we want God to be God. Ofte times we just don't see that is what we really want.
